div.h1: Welcome to Fluvanna County Public Schools

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-5919 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-news

h2.a: Fluvanna Childcare Need for Essential Personnel- Needs Assessment

div.p: Fluvanna County Public Schools is determining the need for essential personnel childcare during the COVID-19 outbreak. This service is available to Fluvanna County residents who work in state defined “essential personnel” positions.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-5907 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-fluvanna-high-school category-fluvanna-middle-school category-news

h2.a: Fluvanna County School Board Approves 2020-2021 School Calendar

div.p: On Wednesday, March 11, 2020, the Fluvanna County School Board adopted a school calendar for the 2020-21 school year. The school calendar was developed with input from parents and school staff.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-5877 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-fluvanna-high-school category-fluvanna-middle-school category-news

h2.a: FLUVANNA COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOL’S PLAN FOR MEAL DISTRIBUTION DURING COVID-19 CLOSURE

div.p: As we all take precautions to protect ourselves and others from the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19), we can not forget that our students and children still need good food.

There are many children in our community that rely on the free and reduced-price meals they receive at school. These meals may be the only nutritious food that they will receive on a given day. Therefore, FCPS is offering grab and go meals free of charge to children, 18 years and under, from low-income areas.

Each child will receive 5 breakfast and 5 lunch meals that meet USDA meal pattern requirements. The meals will consist of items that families can prepare at home as well as ready to eat items. Food safety guidelines and food preparation instructions will be included with the meals.

Meals may be picked up at the Fluvanna County High School cafeteria on Tuesday, March 17 and Wednesday, March 18 from 7 a.m. -4 p.m. Per USDA guidelines, an adult must be accompanied by a child in order to receive the meals.

If assistance is needed with transportation, call the front office at your child’s school between 10 a.m. -3 p.m. to make arrangements for home delivery.The USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-5875 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-fluvanna-high-school category-fluvanna-middle-school category-news

h2.a: World Languages Textbooks Available for Review

div.p: At its regular meeting on Wednesday, April 1, 2020, the Fluvanna County School Board will consider adoption of the textbook committee’s recommendation for a textbook for world languages.

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb post-5872 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-fluvanna-high-school category-fluvanna-middle-school category-news

h2.a: Fluvanna County Public Schools COVID-19 Preparation Plan and Frequently Asked Questions

div.p: Please be aware that this is a continually developing situation. This information could change and will be updated accordingly.

img.alt: Fluvanna Public Schools Calendar of Events

div.span: The Fluvanna County School Board is committed to nondiscrimination with regard to sex, gender, race, color, national origin, disability, religion, ancestry, age, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. This commitment will prevail in all of its policies and practices concerning staff, students, educational programs and services, and individuals and entities with whom the Board does business. Mr. Don Stribling, Executive Director of Human Resources/Student Services/Operations is designated as the responsible person (Compliance Officer) regarding assurances of nondiscrimination. Any complaint alleging discrimination based on a disability shall be directed to Ms. Jennifer Valentine, Director of Special Education (the Section 504 Coordinator). Both may be reached at the following address: 14455 James Madison Highway, Palmyra, VA 22963; telephone (434) 589-8208. The Fluvanna County School Board is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

div.p: Designed by Elegant Themes | Powered by WordPress
